intro: Helonias anthericoides, commonly known as the swamp pink, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, acidic soils. Its leaves are grass-like and often form a dense rosette near the ground. Helonias anthericoides plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing food and shelter for various insects and small animals.
